alert.note: Alert for Caswell; Rockingham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 5:46PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Storms will impact portions of eastern Rockingham, Caswell, northeastern Roanoke, southwestern Campbell, Pittsylvania, Bedford, southeastern Botetourt and northeastern Franklin Counties, the City of Danville and the eastern City of Roanoke through 615 PM EST... At 546 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking storms along a line extending from Vinton to Callands to near Camp Springs. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Roanoke... Danville... Vinton... Bedford... Altavista... Yanceyville... and Bethel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for north central North Carolina...and central and south central Virginia.
